title: Engraved Stone at V&A museum
content:
Ever since visiting the V&A in London I have been wanting to find out more about [THIS](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122122757/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/criminalintent/2744038788/sizes/l/) engraved type.

It’s obviously hand-done and possible one-of-a-kind. How would one classify the style? Is it art nouveau? Have any of you seen fonts like this?

Any info would be useful!

Thanks

 [‹ Travel + Country Dingbat recommendations?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122122757/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48568 "Go to previous forum topic") [quotations ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122122757/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48622 "Go to next forum topic")
author: thompson

comments.content: It reminds me of [Frutiger](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122122757/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Adrian%252BFrutiger)’s [Pompeijana](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122122757/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/pompeijana_std_roman/) and Bouwsma’s [Pompeii Campitals](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122122757/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/pompeii_capitals/) both [modeled after early Roman inscriptions](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122122757/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/pompeijana/roman/?refby=typographica) and perhaps named for those found in the architectural ruins of Pompeii.

It is based on Rustic Capitals with a bit of contemporary twist. It may have been done by Richard Kindersley, but that needs to be checked.

Ieuan Rees may know the “chiseler.”

Michael
great information. I’ll see where it takes me. Thanks!

Stephen’s suggestion of Pompeijana is likely the closest you’ll find, but I thought I’d mention other fonts in this Rustic Roman style. [Mouserfonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122122757/http:/www.mouserfonts.com/Showcase/mous001.htm) offers, among lots of other wonderful freebies, Rustic Capitals and [Michael Scarpitti](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122122757/http:/www.myfonts.com/browse/person/scarpitti/michael/) hs made several fonts in this vein for SCriptorium.
